title: Calories in a Gold Potato
meta_description: Discover calories in a gold potato, including macros like carbs, protein, and fiber, plus per-potato nutrition facts and preparation tweaks.
assumptions: Medium size (~150 g), baked with skin on, no added fats, salt, or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by potato size, variety, cooking method, and soil conditions. Check labels or use a scale for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A medium baked gold potato provides ~130 kcal and ~4 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in a medium gold potato?
faqs.a: About 130 kcal for a medium baked gold potato with skin.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a gold potato?
faqs.a: Roughly 30 g carbs, including 3.4 g fiber, per medium potato.

faqs.q: Are gold potatoes low in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, only 0.2 g total fat per medium baked gold potato.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in a gold potato?
faqs.a: Baking retains more nutrients; boiling may slightly lower calories due to water absorption.

faqs.q: How much protein in a gold potato?
faqs.a: Approximately 3.6 g protein per medium gold potato.
